subject: Science
title: Whale Falls: Oases on the Seafloor
description: A quick win: understand Whale Falls: Oases on the Seafloor.

hook.text: When a whale dies and sinks, its body feeds deep-sea life for up to 50 years.

buildup.text: Scavengers like hagfish and sleeper sharks arrive first, stripping flesh in months.

discovery.text: Then smaller organisms colonize the bones, extracting lipids stored inside.

twist.text: Bacteria break down the bones using chemosynthesis â€” similar to hydrothermal vent life.

climax.text: A single whale carcass creates an entire ecosystem on the otherwise barren deep-sea floor.

punchline.text: A dead whale becomes a 50-year buffet on the ocean's emptiest floor.

quiz.question: How long can a whale fall sustain deep-sea life?
